entries.title: Heritage Foundation president Kevin Roberts defended Tucker Carlson and his controversial interview with white supremacist Nick Fuentes. The fall-out has shaken the conservative think tank to its core.
Senate Democrats, fresh off election wins, are expected to block a new Republican proposal aimed at ending a record-long government shutdown
Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi says she won’t run for re-election and plans to leave her seat in Congress at the end of this term, drawing to a close a decadeslong political career
In Charts: In Virginia and New Jersey gubernatorial elections, the working-class, Hispanic and Black neighborhoods that helped return Trump to the White House moved back to Democrats
Senate Majority Leader John Thune expects Senate Republicans to vote on a new proposal Friday that aims to end the government shutdown
Republican Rep. Elise Stefanik, an ally of President Trump, announced a run for New York governor in next year’s election, challenging Democratic incumbent Gov. Kathy Hochul

Democrats sought information about Social Security Administration head Frank Bisignano, ex-CEO of Fiserv, after leaders of the payments firm said it wouldn’t reach financial forecasts set by their ex boss
A federal judge has ordered the Trump administration to fully fund food-assistance benefits for November by Friday, criticizing the government’s efforts so far to make payments during the shutdown
The Treasury Department is investigating small-business government contracts worth about $9 billion
The Supreme Court allowed the Trump administration to move ahead for now with a policy requiring that Americans’ passports reflect the holders’ sex at birth
Many GOP lawmakers are saying no—for now—to President Trump’s plan to end the record-breaking shutdown by killing the 60-vote filibuster rule
Allies of President Trump and Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. are looking to the Make America Healthy Again movement to boost GOP prospects in next year’s midterm elections
Virginia voters elected Jay Jones as attorney general despite a texting scandal that might once have disqualified him
Economic discontent helped deliver election wins to Democrats in the New York City mayor’s race and in the governor’s races in New Jersey and Virginia
Republican candidates weren’t the only ones who fell short in Tuesday’s elections. Pollsters had a bad night, too.
Maine Rep. Jared Golden, one of the most vulnerable House Democrats, said he wouldn’t seek re-election for another term, citing the threat of political violence and dysfunction in Washington

The Trump administration is still deciding whether to push Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro out of power or extract concessions from him, according to U.S. officials familiar with the deliberations
The Trump administration believes it can continue its lethal military campaign against alleged drug-running boats without congressional authorization
SpaceX is set to receive $2 billion to develop satellites that can track missiles and aircraft under President Trump’s Golden Dome project
A day after President Trump vowed to resume testing of nuclear weapons, the White House wasn’t answering questions about the details, leaving experts and insiders uncertain what he meant
President Trump said that he has ordered the Pentagon to “start testing our Nuclear Weapons on an equal basis” with Russia and China
